300. Harrison, (Mrs. Edwin)
What did early Canadian farmers eat?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.

Name: Mrs. Edwin Harrison
Address: Dahinda, Sask.
[Signature]
Birthplace: England

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start homesteading in eastern Canada? 1911
Where did you set up homesteading? Dahinda, Sask.
Where had you been living before that? Canada, England
For how many people did you prepare meals? Sometimes 5-7, 4-6, 3-2
How far was it to your nearest store? 20 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? Twice a month
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Fine Rose
In what quantities did you buy it? 100 pounds
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $3.00
How much did you use Graham flour? None
Whole wheat flour? None
Was flour milled locally? Yes
How far away? 80 miles
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? 60 cents
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal? Yes
Whole wheat? Yes
Farina? Yes
Other?
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? At times
How did you grind it? Grain Chopper
